intro: Nopalea dejecta, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, spiny stems and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant is adapted to harsh desert conditions, with thick leaves that reduce water loss and deep root systems for water absorption. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind and animals. Nopalea dejecta plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing food and shelter for desert wildlife.
